text: Bury Transport Museum is a transport museum in Bury, Greater Manchester, situated in the former Castlecroft Goods Warehouse, a Grade II listed building from 1846,British Listed Buildings Bury Transport Museum on Castlecroft Road, with the main entrance from Bolton Street, BL9 0EY. It was started in 1973 by volunteers of the East Lancashire Railway, Bury Times, July 23, 1974 had to close in 2003 because of roof problems but opened again in 2010.Bury Times 01 April 2010 Duke opens refurbished transport museum and black pudding factory in Bury File:Bury Transport Museum East Exterior April 2017.jpg|East Exterior File:Bury Transport Museum Interior April 2017 01.jpg|Part of vehicles display File:Steam Roller Hilda, Thomas Green, Bury April 2017.jpg|Steam roller 'Hilda' File:Bury Transport Museum Interior April 2017 03.jpg|Model of woman sitting on a station bench where visitors can also sit ==See also== *Listed buildings in Bury ==References== Category:Grade II listed buildings in the Metropolitan Borough of Bury Category:Museums in Greater Manchester Category:Transport museums in England Category:History of transport in Greater Manchester
title: Bury Transport Museum
